intro: Polygala grandiflora var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb with slender, erect stems and small, often hairy leaves. The plant produces clusters of delicate, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in open grasslands. Due to its unique floral structure and habitat preferences, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
